com.navis.framework.portal.context.server

Interface IServerContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultServerContext

    public interface IServerContext
    Handles the lifecycle of the server application. This concept of an application is broader than a deployed servlet. The servlet or standalone application can call these APIs

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String BEAN_ID 
      static java.lang.String JVM_SHUTDOWN_PROPERTY 
      static java.lang.String JVM_SHUTDOWN_PROPERTY_ENABLED

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Called during a shutdown of an application.
      NodeStatusTypeEnum getNodeStatus()
      We store this locally just in case the database updates did not work if database is down
      IServerConfig getServerConfig() 
      java.util.Date getStartOfInitialization() 
      void handleFatalError(java.lang.Exception inException)
      Call only in catastrophic cases when the entire application should shutdown.
      void initialize(IServerConfig inConfig)
      Caller should NOT try to catch exceptions as this means the application is unrecoverable and has failed to startup
      boolean isServerActive()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(@NotNull
                IServerConfig inConfig)
        Caller should NOT try to catch exceptions as this means the application is unrecoverable and has failed to startup

        jvm is allowed to initialize only once. Will throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        inConfig -

      • handleFatalError

        void handleFatalError(java.lang.Exception inException)
        Call only in catastrophic cases when the entire application should shutdown. Only when JVM_SHUTDOWN_PROPERTY is set, the jvm will be shutdown. Note in theory we only want to shut down the servlet. However, there is a bug where servlet shutdown of coherence leaves objects around which are not garbage collected.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Called during a shutdown of an application. Currently called by the DefaultServletContextListener

      • getServerConfig

        @Nullable
IServerConfig getServerConfig()
        Returns:
        null if the context has not been initialized

      • getNodeStatus

        NodeStatusTypeEnum getNodeStatus()
        We store this locally just in case the database updates did not work if database is down

      • getStartOfInitialization

        java.util.Date getStartOfInitialization()
        Returns:
        timestamp when the server context was first requested to initialize

      • isServerActive

        boolean isServerActive()
        Returns:
        true, if server is active, false otherwise
